document_title: Monkeypox: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Up to now, there is no specific treatment or medicine for monkeypox. However, patients should not worry too much because the disease can improve and go away on its own without treatment.
Some drugs that are believed to be able to treat monkeypox include: The antiviral drug cidofovir, the new antiviral drug tecovirimat, the research drug brincidofovir (CMX001),... - These are inherently active drugs. against smallpox virus in monkeys. However, there are currently no drugs being researched or used in endemic areas to treat monkeypox.
In particular, patients who have been vaccinated against smallpox are still at risk of contracting monkeypox. However, the symptoms of the disease are often milder, do not progress seriously and have a low risk of complications, and do not require intervention.
